title: Ravenna
description: A city of northern Adriatic Italy that served as the capital of the Western Roman Empire from AD 402 until 476.

properties.description: An ancient mausoleum in Ravenna, Italy, that contains three sarcophagi. These are connected to Galla Placidia (d. AD 450), daughter of the Roman Emperor Theodosius I, to  Valentinian III (her son), and Constantius III.
properties.title: Mausoleum of Galla Placidia

properties.description: Baptistry built by Theodoric the Great in the late fifth or early sixth century AD
properties.title: Arian Baptistry

properties.description: A monument built in Ravenna, Italy, ca. AD 520 by Theodoric the Great as his future tomb.
properties.title: Mausoleum of Theodoric

properties.description: A church in Ravenna, Italy, established by Bishop Ecclesius in AD 527.
properties.title: Basilica of San Vitale

properties.description: A basilica in Ravenna, Italy, erected by Theodoric the Great in the first quarter of the sixth century AD and originally dedicated to Christ the Redeemer
properties.title: Basilica of Sant'Apollinare Nuovo

properties.description: An octagonal brick structure erected by Bishop Ursus (late fourth or early fifth century AD) as part of a  Basilica (destroyed in 1734). Bishop Neon completed the baptistry at the end of the fifth century AD.
properties.title: Baptistry of Neon
